title: AI Research Assistant

hero.headline: Build Your Own Research Agents, Not Someone Else's
hero.subtext: Build TypeScript agents that search, analyze, and synthesize data your way—with complete observability in VoltOps.
hero.mermaidDiagram:
---
config:
  look: neo
  theme: base
  themeVariables:
    primaryColor: "rgba(5, 150, 105, 0.2)"
    primaryTextColor: "#34d399"
    primaryBorderColor: "rgba(16, 185, 129, 0.2)"
    lineColor: "rgba(16, 185, 129, 0.4)"
    secondaryColor: "rgba(5, 150, 105, 0.1)"
    tertiaryColor: "rgba(5, 150, 105, 0.05)"
    background: "transparent"
    mainBkg: "rgba(5, 150, 105, 0.2)"
    secondBkg: "rgba(5, 150, 105, 0.1)"
    actorBkg: "rgba(5, 150, 105, 0.2)"
    actorBorder: "rgba(16, 185, 129, 0.2)"
    actorTextColor: "#34d399"
    signalColor: "rgba(16, 185, 129, 0.4)"
    signalTextColor: "#34d399"
    sequenceNumberColor: "#34d399"
    labelBoxBkgColor: "rgba(249, 115, 22, 0.2)"
    labelBoxBorderColor: "rgba(251, 146, 60, 0.3)"
    labelTextColor: "#fb923c"
    loopTextColor: "#34d399"
    activationBorderColor: "rgba(16, 185, 129, 0.2)"
    activationBkgColor: "rgba(5, 150, 105, 0.2)"
---
sequenceDiagram
  autonumber
  participant U as User
  participant VA as VoltAgent
  participant RA as Research Agent
  participant T as Tools (Search/APIs/Web)
  participant VDB as Vector DB
  participant LLM as LLM
  participant O as VoltOps

  U->>VA: Research Query
  VA->>RA: Initialize Research Agent
  RA->>RA: Parse Query & Strategy
  RA->>T: Search Multiple Sources
  T-->>RA: Raw Data
  RA->>VDB: Store & Index Results
  VDB-->>RA: Relevant Context
  RA->>LLM: Analyze & Synthesize
  LLM-->>RA: Insights
  RA->>O: Trace Decisions & Sources
  RA-->>VA: Research Report
  VA-->>U: Final Analysis

painPoints: Pre-built research tools don't understand your domain
No control over search strategies or data sources
Black-box AI with no visibility into decisions
Generic agents that can't adapt to your workflow
solutions: Build agents that understand your specific domain
Define custom search strategies and integrate any API
Complete observability with VoltOps tracing
Agents that evolve with your requirements

features.title: Your Code, Your Agent
features.description: Write TypeScript to define exactly how your agent searches, filters, and synthesizes. No black boxes, no vendor lock-in.

features.title: Plug In Any Data Source
features.description: Connect via API or custom tools; vector DBs included. Integrate proprietary or public data without waiting on vendors.

features.title: Stateful Memory System
features.description: Agents maintain context across conversations. Use Chroma, Pinecone, or Qdrant for long-term memory.

features.title: Debug Like Regular Code
features.description: VoltOps shows every tool call, token usage, and decision path. Set breakpoints, inspect state, optimize performance.

exampleAgents.name: Patent Research Agent
exampleAgents.description: Searches patent databases, cross-references claims, identifies prior art, and generates comprehensive reports.

exampleAgents.name: Market Intelligence Agent
exampleAgents.description: Monitors competitors, analyzes trends, aggregates news, and produces strategic insights from multiple sources.

exampleAgents.name: Academic Literature Agent
exampleAgents.description: Finds relevant papers, extracts key findings, builds citation graphs, and summarizes research developments.

capabilities: Search across multiple data sources simultaneously
Synthesize complex information into actionable insights

howItWorks.title: Build with VoltAgent
howItWorks.description: Compose search → analyze → synthesize pipelines in TypeScript.

howItWorks.title: Connect data & tools
howItWorks.description: Wire web scrapers, APIs, warehouses, and vector DBs.

howItWorks.title: Add memory & citations
howItWorks.description: Index papers/notes; ground outputs with sources and metadata.

howItWorks.title: Observe in VoltOps
howItWorks.description: Trace retrieval paths, token/latency, and tool usage; iterate fast.

title: Customer Support Agent
navDescription: Build custom support agents with TypeScript

hero.headline: Build Custom Support Agents in TypeScript
hero.subtext: Program support agents that match your exact workflows, connect to your stack, and stay fully observable in VoltOps.
hero.mermaidDiagram:
---
config:
  look: neo
  theme: base
  themeVariables:
    primaryColor: "rgba(5, 150, 105, 0.2)"
    primaryTextColor: "#34d399"
    primaryBorderColor: "rgba(16, 185, 129, 0.2)"
    lineColor: "rgba(16, 185, 129, 0.4)"
    secondaryColor: "rgba(5, 150, 105, 0.1)"
    tertiaryColor: "rgba(5, 150, 105, 0.05)"
    background: "transparent"
    mainBkg: "rgba(5, 150, 105, 0.2)"
    secondBkg: "rgba(5, 150, 105, 0.1)"
    actorBkg: "rgba(5, 150, 105, 0.2)"
    actorBorder: "rgba(16, 185, 129, 0.2)"
    actorTextColor: "#34d399"
    signalColor: "rgba(16, 185, 129, 0.4)"
    signalTextColor: "#34d399"
    sequenceNumberColor: "#34d399"
    labelBoxBkgColor: "rgba(249, 115, 22, 0.2)"
    labelBoxBorderColor: "rgba(251, 146, 60, 0.3)"
    labelTextColor: "#fb923c"
    loopTextColor: "#34d399"
    activationBorderColor: "rgba(16, 185, 129, 0.2)"
    activationBkgColor: "rgba(5, 150, 105, 0.2)"
---
sequenceDiagram
  autonumber
  participant U as User
  participant CH as Channel (Chat/Email/Slack)
  participant VA as VoltAgent
  participant M as Memory (Vector DB / KB)
  participant T as Tools (CRM/Billing/Logistics/APIs)
  participant L as LLM
  participant O as VoltOps

  U->>CH: Message / Ticket
  CH->>VA: Incoming request
  VA->>VA: Route + Policy checks + Guardrails
  VA->>M: Retrieve relevant KB / history
  M-->>VA: Context
  VA->>T: Tool calls (lookup order, create ticket, refund...)
  T-->>VA: Results
  VA->>L: Compose / Reason with context
  L-->>VA: Draft answer / action plan
  VA->>O: Trace decision + tools + tokens
  VA-->>CH: Final response (+ actions)
  CH-->>U: Resolution

painPoints: No-code chatbots break with complex business logic
SaaS platforms charge per conversation and limit customization
Black-box AI can't explain or justify answers
Generic bots don't understand your products or policies
solutions: Write real support logic in TypeScript (triage, routing, escalation, SLAs)
Run in your own stack and control your cost profile
VoltOps gives end-to-end traces of every tool call and decision
Agents use your KB, policies, and systems—not generic prompts

features.title: Full Code Control
features.description: Implement multi-step workflows, policy checks, and SLA logic in TypeScript—no flowchart limits.

features.title: Integrate Any System
features.description: Connect CRM, ticketing, billing, logistics, or internal APIs via code. No vendor waitlists.

features.title: Memory & Policy Awareness
features.description: Maintain conversation state, retrieve from KB/vector DBs, and enforce policies deterministically.

features.title: VoltOps Observability
features.description: Trace decisions, tokens, tool calls, and latency. Debug like regular code and ship with confidence.

exampleAgents.name: Enterprise Technical Support Agent
exampleAgents.description: Diagnoses API errors, inspects logs, validates auth/quotas, and proposes code-level fixes with escalation rules.

exampleAgents.name: E-commerce Service Agent
exampleAgents.description: Looks up orders, creates returns, checks inventory/shipments, and applies policy-based resolutions.

exampleAgents.name: Multi-Tier Escalation Agent
exampleAgents.description: Routes by sentiment, priority, ACV, and SLA breach risk; hands off with structured context for humans.

capabilities: Triage tickets across chat, email, Slack
Execute actions in CRMs, ticketing, billing, and logistics
Retrieve verified answers from KB and policies
Apply deterministic guardrails and audit every decision
Operate in multiple languages and channels

howItWorks.description: Program your support workflows and policies in TypeScript.

howItWorks.title: Connect data & tools

title: Code Review Assistant
navDescription: Automated code reviews with AI insights

hero.headline: Build Code Review Agents That Know Your Codebase
hero.subtext: Program review agents that understand your architecture and standards—with full visibility in VoltOps.

painPoints: Generic linters don't understand your architecture
Static analysis tools miss business logic issues
Pre-built bots can't enforce custom patterns
No way to codify your team's specific knowledge
solutions: Build agents that understand your architecture
Implement custom checks for your business logic
Encode your team's patterns and best practices
Evolve review logic as your codebase grows

features.title: Program Your Review Logic
features.description: Write TypeScript to define exactly what to check, how to analyze code, and when to flag issues.

features.title: Integrate Your Tools
features.description: Connect to GitHub, GitLab, security scanners, or internal tools via APIs. Your agent, your integrations.

features.title: Context-Aware Analysis
features.description: Agents can access git history, related PRs, documentation, and issue trackers for informed reviews.

features.title: Transparent Decisions
features.description: VoltOps shows why your agent flagged issues. Debug false positives like fixing bugs in code.

exampleAgents.name: Architecture Compliance Agent
exampleAgents.description: Validates that changes follow your microservices patterns, API contracts, and dependency rules.

exampleAgents.name: Performance Review Agent
exampleAgents.description: Analyzes code for performance issues, suggests optimizations, and flags potential bottlenecks.

exampleAgents.name: Security Audit Agent
exampleAgents.description: Scans for vulnerabilities, checks dependencies, validates auth patterns, and enforces security policies.

capabilities: Analyze code for bugs and security vulnerabilities
Enforce coding standards and best practices
Track technical debt and code quality metrics
